questions.question: Which of the following is NOT typically considered a common instrument used in sound healing?

Which type of singing bowl is NOT mentioned in the lesson plan?
choices: Both Tibetan and Crystal are mentioned

questions.question: What is the term for the character or quality of a musical sound distinct from its pitch and intensity?

What is the primary focus of the homework assignment?
choices: Writing an essay on sound healing theory

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT listed as a key vocabulary term in the lesson plan?
What is the term for a tone produced by vibration of a string or column of air in an exact fraction of its length?
What activity is used as a warm-up in the lesson plan?
How many common sound healing instruments should students be able to identify and describe by the end of the lesson?
What is the purpose of introducing local Timorese instruments in the lesson?
choices: To replace traditional sound healing instruments
To teach students how to make these instruments
To compare their sound quality with modern instruments

questions.question: What is the term for any frequency higher than the fundamental frequency of a sound?
How many instruments should students be able to demonstrate basic playing techniques for by the end of the lesson?
What type of seating is suggested for students during the lesson?

choices: How to layer and combine different sounds
Creating a sense of flow or journey

questions.question: What is the purpose of the guided listening activity in the lesson?
choices: To experience how sounds affect the body and emotions
questions.answer: To experience how sounds affect the body and emotions

questions.question: What is the optional component of the homework assignment?
Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a topic to be explained for each instrument during the main lesson content?
What activity is used to review the instruments at the end of the lesson?
What is the term for the number of sound wave cycles per second, determining pitch?
Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a common sound healing instrument in the lesson plan?

choices: To incorporate them into sound healing practices
To teach students how to make these instruments
questions.answer: To incorporate them into sound healing practices

questions.question: How long is allocated for the presentation of the main lesson content?
What is the purpose of the instrument rotation activity?
choices: To allow students to practice playing techniques and experience vibrations
questions.answer: To allow students to practice playing techniques and experience vibrations

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a topic for class discussion in the wrap-up?
choices: How different instruments might be suited for various healing purposes
How to integrate local Timorese instruments into sound healing practices
The history of sound healing instruments
questions.answer: The history of sound healing instruments

questions.question: What is the suggested length for the homework assignment report?

What is the primary focus of the production task in the lesson?
choices: Writing a research paper on sound healing

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a component to include in the homework assignment report?
choices: Ideas for incorporating it into sound healing practices

questions.question: What is the main purpose of pre-teaching key vocabulary at the beginning of the lesson?
choices: To prepare students for understanding technical terms related to sound healing
questions.answer: To prepare students for understanding technical terms related to sound healing
